channel.title: Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain
channel.description:
How many of you going to pick this up in less than a month?
[url=https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLj-oO8-rRYbgAdUPXD6EzlLYwd05FDiNX]Playlist of development videos+trailers and gameplay videos[/url] reaching as far back as 2012/3
I'm a huge MGS fan and can probably answer any question from the series barring any non-canon games (AC!D, Portable Ops). Kojima says he was developing the FOX engine a few months or so after he finished MGS4 so you can technically say this game has been in development for roughly 7 years now.

item.title: Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain
item.dc:creator: @LegoApple LegoApple
item.description:
@LegoApple wrote:

Its one of the best games I ever played.

Read full topic
item.source: Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain

item.title: Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Loveandpower:

From the gameplay videos I watched it looks absolutely amazing. Shame I am bad at stealth or this would be really fun.

It is actually very forgiving, you’re given a fuckload of options and ways of playing the game. I find it quite difficult to actually die in this game - in the main non-boss missions, at least.

Read full topic
item.source: Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain

item.source: Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain

item.title: Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

Not much storytelling, repetitive missions, disappointing ending, feels rushed/unfinished… However somehow it still managed to get me play through it and enjoy it from time to time, not sure if I should hate it or love it… It’s not anything like MGS 1-4, which is not a good thing in my opinion.

EDIT: The ending scene was not bad in fact it was amazing, however I don’t think the game should have ended after that as it seemed more like a new beginning.

Read full topic
item.source: Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain

item.title: Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

Game is great, story is slightly sub-par for a MGS game but nonetheless, the best MGS I’ve played in a LONG time. I don’t have it for PC yet, but I heard even lower-end PC’s can run it on high settings

Read full topic
